intro: Psychotria brachiata, commonly known as the Amazonian Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
